chapter.title: Operating &ceph; Services
chapter.para: &ceph; related services are operated with the systemctl command. The operation takes place on the node you are currently logged in to. You need to have &rootuser; privileges to be able to operate on &ceph; services.

sect1.title: Starting, Stopping, and Restarting Services using Targets
sect1.para: To facilitate starting, stopping, and restarting all the services of a particular type (for example all &ceph; services, or all MONs, or all OSDs) on a node, &ceph; provides the following &systemd; unit files:
sect1.screen: &prompt.root; ls /usr/lib/systemd/system/ceph*.target ceph.target ceph-osd.target ceph-mon.target ceph-mgr.target ceph-mds.target ceph-radosgw.target ceph-rbd-mirror.target
sect1.para: To start/stop/restart all &ceph; services on the node, run:
sect1.screen: &prompt.root;systemctl stop ceph.target &prompt.root;systemctl start ceph.target &prompt.root;systemctl restart ceph.target
sect1.para: To start/stop/restart all OSDs on the node, run:
sect1.screen: &prompt.root;systemctl stop ceph-osd.target &prompt.root;systemctl start ceph-osd.target &prompt.root;systemctl restart ceph-osd.target
sect1.para: Commands for the other targets are analogous.

sect1.title: Starting, Stopping, and Restarting Individual Services
sect1.para: You can operate individual services using the following parameterized &systemd; unit files:
To use these commands, you first need to identify the name of the service you want to operate. See to learn more about services identification.
To start/stop/restart the osd.1 service, run:
sect1.screen: &prompt.root;systemctl stop ceph-osd@1.service &prompt.root;systemctl start ceph-osd@1.service &prompt.root;systemctl restart ceph-osd@1.service
sect1.para: Commands for the other service types are analogous.
